intro: Humboltia microcardia, commonly known as the dwarf huito, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of South America, particularly Chile and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It grows as an evergreen shrub, often reaching a height of less than one meter. Humboltia microcardia is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
